law.catch_line: Recordkeeping and identification of trust property.

text.section: A trustee shall keep adequate records of the administration of the trust.
A trustee shall keep trust property separate from the trusteeâ€™s own property.

Except as otherwise provided in subsection (4) of this section, a trustee shall cause the trust property to be designated so that the interest of the trust, to the extent feasible, appears in records maintained by a party other than a trustee or beneficiary.
If the trustee maintains records clearly indicating the respective interests, a trustee may invest as a whole the property of two (2) or more separate trusts.

law.history: Created 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 25, sec. 69, effective July 15, 2014.
